page.title: 06TUXFORD 1(Comp. Sch.6 )
page.content: viewing as immediately to the rear is an audio visual aids room staffed by a full time technician. {TUXFORD & SURROUNDING AREAS Although most squares are covered by arable farmland, some have a partial cover of high density population housing estates. The crops are wheat, barley, oilseed rape and potatoes. The cereals when harvested are stored and dried at Kenneth Wilson's store in Ash Vale (75.7O). Here the cereals and Agrichemicals are stored before being transported to mills and farms. On the same site which was the Great Midland Railway Station and repair sheds. One of these is now used by Saundby Welding, a company that repairs the bodywork of the lorries that carry coal to the power stations of the Trent. On the edge of this site new factories are opening, a
